. Dust affects Earth’s radiative balance directly through interactions with radiation, termed the direct radiative effect (DRE), and indirectly through interactions with clouds, biogeochemistry, and the cryosphere
2, 3 . These indirect effects are poorly understood, with large and poorly quantified uncertainties
2, 3 . We therefore restrict our discussion to the direct dust–climate feedback arising from changes in the dust direct radiative effect only, which is better understood and has a better quantified uncertainty
1 .
